intro: Helminthia comosa var. spinulosa, commonly known as the hairy helminthia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and dry landscapes.
